description:
Manual games allow you to set custom check locations and custom item names that will be rolled into a multiworld.
This allows any variety of game -- PC, console, board games, Microsoft Word memes... really anything -- to be part of a multiworld randomizer.
The key component to including these games is some level of manual restriction. Since the items are not actually withheld from the player,
the player must manually refrain from using these gathered items until the tracker shows that they have been acquired or sent.

m0.0.1.description:
An initial release of the manual based implementation, mostly present for convenience so people don't have to compile the mod manually.
Requires [main manual apworld](https://github.com/ManualForArchipelago/Manual) to function (I use the manual_stable_20241119 apworld, but it SHOULD function on any modern version in theory).

To install the mod, make sure that BepInEx and FP2Lib are installed and enabled (using [Freedom Manager](https://gamebanana.com/tools/10870) will take care of this), then just extract the Archipelago.7z file to the game's root and merge the folders when prompted.
m0.0.1.title: Manual 0.0.1

m0.0.2.description:
An updated release of the manual based implementation, mostly present for convenience so people don't have to compile the mod manually.
Requires [main manual apworld](https://github.com/ManualForArchipelago/Manual) to function (I use the manual_stable_20241119 apworld, but it SHOULD function on any modern version in theory).

To install the mod, make sure that BepInEx and FP2Lib are installed and enabled (using [Freedom Manager](https://gamebanana.com/tools/10870) will take care of this), then just extract the Archipelago.7z file to the game's root and merge the folders when prompted.

### Changes since Manual 0.0.1:
- Added Enemy and Boss Sanity options (including a counter on the world map to track how many enemy/boss sanity locations have been checked/exist).
- Added RingLink.
- Merged some options together after learning what the manual system can really do.
- Added the Fast Weapon's Core option.
- Added a couple of customisation systems, allowing the moon in the Merga fight to be changed based on other games in the Multiworld and for custom sounds to be played for item recieves.
- Reworded the "Received multiple of item from player" message to avoid terrible grammar.
- Base game characters will now play their shocked animation and a different voice line if finding a Trap Item in a Chest.
- Replaced the slightly useless Core count on the map pause menu with a more useful Time Capsule count.
- Added new items (for information on these, refer to the [Wiki page](https://github.com/Knuxfan24/Freedom-Planet-2-Archipelago/wiki/Items)):
  - Filler Items:
    - Crystals
    - Extra Life
    - Invincibility
    - Wood Shield
    - Earth Shield
    - Water Shield
    - Fire Shield
    - Metal Shield
    - Powerup
  - Trap Items:
    - Spring Trap
    - PowerPoint Trap
    - Zoom Trap
    - Aaa Trap
    - Spike Ball Trap
    - Pixellation Trap
    - Rail Trap

### Issues:
- Some YAML options seem to just not work, causing a generation failure? (Disabling Chest Tracer items all together seems to be a common cause).
- The Template YAML has some redundant options at the bottom.
m0.0.2.title: Manual 0.0.2
